channel.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
channel.description:
Hi. I have played some servers that have "two worlds" that are acting like 2 different servers. Because that's what it is, is 2 servers running at once. I have found a way to have 2 servers running at once loading the character files from both servers because the "two world" server have 2 sets of character files.
Here's how you do it. Note that this is probably more work then it's worth.
[b]Step 1[/b]
Run your world 1 server (your regular one)
[b]Step 2[/b]
Find your server.java file and open it. Search for "listen". The port should be set to 43594 or 5555. Change it to 43595. Make sure you set one of the listening ports to 43595 and the other one to 5555 or 43595. Compile your server then run it. Now you have 2 servers running from the same set of files.
[b]UPDATING[/B]
Updating will now be a pain. When you do a update you have to set the port back to 43594 then compile then redo the steps above.
[b]OTHER GLITCHES[/B]
Now you open up your server to duping, not losing items when you die and a character file may not save correctly. Players could now login to both servers at the same time. If they do this one of their profiles won't save correctly.
[b]Last Part[/b]
To do this you will either have to have a client that is able to switch ports by clicking change world or change port tool or something or you will have to make a world 1 and world 2 client. World 2 running the port as 43595.
If I missed something or something does not work please tell me and I will fix it.

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

Or you could be normal and add a login server

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Using SQL you could still run 2 servers on 1 pc, but then you could also expand and get 2 containers if you wanted to (really reducing on lag)

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

Step 2

Find your server.java file and open it. Search for “listen”. The port should be set to 43594 or 5555. Change it to 43595. Make sure you set both of the listening ports to 43595. Compile your server then run it. Now you have 2 servers running from the same set of files.


that is wrong, consider to what you are saying. both servers can NOT run on the same port, it will say “port already used”
so change it to say
Step 2

Find your server.java file and open it. Search for “listen”. The port should be set to 43594 or 5555. Change it to 43595. Make sure you set One of the listening ports to 43595. And another to 43594. Compile your server then run it. Now you have 2 servers running from the same set of files.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“triger545, post:5, topic:399789”]@runewings317: your idea is good but wouldn’t you have to pay for 2 windows vps to have 2 containers?[/quote]No…

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
item.dc:creator: @triger545 triger545
item.description:
@triger545 wrote:

@Fridder: I used Ubuntu and I got mad at it because I couldn’t get my server to work but I think you could have 1 server running from Desktop:1 and another on Desktop:2. It also depends on the amount of RAM and network speed your VPS has.

@runewings317: your idea is good but wouldn’t you have to pay for 2 windows vps to have 2 containers?

@zattion: Thats pretty much what I am saying. Having them run on 2 different listening ports.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server

item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Or we could use SQL and have server on separate containers and make em save to the database and make em so they don’t lag. <.<

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

If I were running a Ubuntu OS, and I wanted to run 2 servers, one on port 43594 and one on port 5555, would I be able to run one in one desktop view, and one in another, if you know what I’m trying to say? Would they lag each other out like how a windows computer would, or would they both be stable like how Ubuntu is suppose to be?

Read full topic

item.title: Making a dual-world 317 server
item.dc:creator: @zattion zattion
item.description:
@zattion wrote:

or you could just have 1 server that listen to 43594 and the other server to 5555
and then go into playersave.java and change:

[code] characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./Data/characters/"+playerName+".txt"));
File1 = true;
} catch(FileNotFoundException fileex1) {
}

	if (File1) {
		//new File ("./characters/"+playerName+".txt");
	} else {
		Misc.println(playerName+": character file not found.");
		p.newPlayer = false;
		return 0;
	}[/code]

and characterfile = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./Data/characters/"+p.playerName+".txt"));

to another place so it loads the same files

Read full topic
